name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using the correct, complete and most uptodate revision of the design drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure correct concrete mix being used in accordance with design drawings and specifications.
○ Manufacturers and suppliers of steel reinforcement materials must be in posession of a current certificate of approval, issued by the ACRS.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design Drawings, VR Section 620
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Test Certificates, Material Data Sheets.
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the contractor holds current calibration certificates conforming to the requirements of AS 2193 Grade B for the jack and pressure gauges or other force measuing devies.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Calibration Certificates
1.5 - Submission of proposed method of transfer of prestress
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure submission of the details of the proposed method of transfer of prestress to the Superintendent for review.
1.6 - Notification of Superintendent prior to stressing operations
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Superintendent shall be given seven days notice of stressing operations.
○ All stressing operations shall take place in the presence of the designated Precast Concrete Surveillance Officer.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Forms shall be manufacutred from steel, except where otherwise approved by the Superintendent.
○ The formwork shall be constucted to as to produce a product in accordance with the design drawings, and with the surface finish and tolerances specified in Section 610.
○ Casting bed to be inspected by designated Precast Concrete Surveillance Officer.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design Drawings , VR Section 620, 610.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All stressing operations shall take place in the presence of the designated Precast Concrete Surveillance Officer,
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the completion of the Inspection Test Checklist (ITC) by the designated Precast Concrete Surveillance Officer.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, ITC Complete
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the following data is recorded and forwarded to the Superintendent prior to delivery of the pre-stressed units to the site:
○ Obtained elongation at completion of tensioning:
○ Obtained tendon force at completion of tensioning:
○ Compressive strength of concrete at time of transfer of prestress:
○ Hog measure following transfer of prestress:
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Record of Data
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure projecting reinforcement is in accordance with that shown on the design drawings and is in good condition.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the identification number, date of casting, the manufacturuers name or registered mark and the maximum mass shall be marked on every precast unit.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed / Certificate of Compliance - Formwork Inspection

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The units shall be supported on bearers clear of the ground. Bearers shall support the units over their full width and be placed perpendicular to the longitudinal axis of the unit.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Units shall not be transported from the precast yard until specified 28 day concrete compressive strength has been achieved, and not before 7 days after casting.

○ No beam shall be transported and erected if it has a bow in excess of 1 in 400 of the length or 75mm whichever is the lesser. Should the bow at any time exceed the maximum allowable limit steps shall be taken to ensure the safety of the unit throughout the journey.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Concrete Test Reports
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
